ResearchProjectDef.label: light alpha mechs
ResearchProjectDef.description: Light specialized worker mechs that can do work types from other mods, as well as light attack mechanoids.

ResearchProjectDef.label: standard alpha mechs
ResearchProjectDef.description: The technology needed for your mechanitor to create and control standard-tier alpha mechanoids.

ResearchProjectDef.label: heavy alpha mechs
ResearchProjectDef.description: The technology needed for your mechanitor to create and control high-tier alpha mechanoids.

ResearchProjectDef.label: ultra-heavy alpha mechs
ResearchProjectDef.description: The advanced technology needed for your mechanitor to create and control ultra-tier alpha mechanoids.

ResearchProjectDef.label: mechanoid beamcasting
ResearchProjectDef.description: Research technology that harnesses advanced energy manipulation techniques to create focused and directed energy beams that can be transmitted across vast distances, and enable the summoning of the formidable Infernus mechanoid.

ResearchProjectDef.label: voidlink connectivity
ResearchProjectDef.description: A communication method that operates on a framework of relay stations positioned across the system. These relay stations, known as "voidlinks," use subspace communication technology to transmit messages at near-light speed, allowing for rapid communication across sub-stellar distances. Enables the summoning of the War Empress mechanoid.

ResearchProjectDef.label: quantum pulse messaging
ResearchProjectDef.description: A cutting-edge communication system that leverages the principles of quantum mechanics to transmit information using more than just binary states of 0s and 1s. The use of these qubits allows for the transmission of complex data, instructions, or commands in a highly efficient and secure manner. Enables the summoning of the Apoptosis mechanoid.

ResearchProjectDef.label: crypto-harmonization
ResearchProjectDef.description: A technology that involves the use of advanced cryptographic algorithms to achieve perfect synchronization and coordination between multiple mechanoid units or systems. It allows for seamless communication, information exchange, and coordination.
